title: Who has made a legendary impact at Liverpool? Garth Crooks' team of the week
description: Who has had an impact like Kevin Keegan and Kenny Dalglish? Who proved he is still world class? Garth Crooks names his team of the week.

title: Covid-19: What is the new three tier system after lockdown?
description: It's tougher than last time following complaints the previous system wasn't sufficient.

title: Prof Sarah Gilbert: The woman who designed the Oxford vaccine
description: Prof Sarah Gilbert got to work quickly on a coronavirus vaccine in January after decades of research.

title: Why the Oxford vaccine matters
description: Why news on this vaccine is particularly important for people living in the UK.

title: Priti Patel: Ministers have duty to stop bullying, says Johnson
description: Boris Johnson writes to ministers to stress importance of "mutual respect" after Priti Patel case.

title: Banksy: Bike from Nottingham hula-hooping girl replaced
description: The bike vanished from its post outside a beauty parlour in Nottingham over the weekend.

title: Israel PM 'flew to Saudi Arabia for secret talks with crown prince'
description: It would mark the first known meeting between the leaders of the two historical foes.

title: BBC Radio 2: Claudia Winkleman replaces Graham Norton on Saturday mornings
description: The Strictly presenter said she was "gobsmacked" to be asked to host the Saturday morning show.

title: Covid-19: Oxford University vaccine is highly effective
description: The vaccine is cheaper than other options and easier to distribute around the world.

title: Narwhal tusk hero a year on from London Bridge attack
description: It's almost a year since Darryn Frost helped to stop a man who was on the rampage, stabbing people.

title: Oxford vaccine: How did they make it so quickly?
description: Good fortune and scientific brilliance were behind the Covid-19 vaccine being developed so quickly.

title: Covid-19: Daily coronavirus test plan to cut contacts' 14-day self-isolation
description: Contacts of people with the virus will not need to quarantine if they test negative, the government says.

title: Covid: Boris Johnson to unveil post-English lockdown plans
description: Boris Johnson will unveil the latest Covid plans, including lifting a ban on outdoor grassroots sport.

title: 'I am not sure if we will finish the season with 11 players' - Klopp urges broadcasters to fix schedule
description: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp says they might struggle to end the season with 11 players and warns "we are all done" unless broadcasters talk to each other about the football schedule.

title: Sea Eagles prop Titmuss dies aged 20
description: Manly Warringah Sea Eagles player Keith Titmuss dies at the age of 20 after falling ill following a training session.

title: US election 2020: Trump ally Chris Christie urges him to accept defeat
description: Former Republican governor Chris Christie calls the president's legal team an "embarrassment".

title: Rangers go 11 points clear - is Celtic's perfect 10 now under real threat?
description: BBC Scotland takes a look at Rangers' remarkable start to the campaign as Celtic drop points again.

title: 'Lark's nan texted her saying she'd had to take her inhaler'
description: In her fourth BBC Sport column England prop Shaunagh Brown talks about enticing fans with exciting wins, messages of support from Olympians and how her family keeps her grounded.

title: Tributes to D-Day veteran who 'taught peace' to children
description: A school in France is named after David Edwards for his work promoting peace and understanding.

title: Newspaper headlines: Christmas 'saved', and mass testing 'promises'
description: Reports that families can meet up during the festive season dominate Monday's front pages.

title: Patrick Quinn: Ice Bucket Challenge activist dies aged 37
description: Patrick Quinn, who had the incurable neurological disorder ALS, helped raise millions for charity.

title: OED Word of the Year expanded for 'unprecedented' 2020
description: This year saw 'hundreds of significant new words' rather than just one, Oxford Dictionaries say.

title: It’s ‘sweet relief’ to be home, says US boy forced to threaten Trump in IS video
description: An American boy made to appear in an IS propaganda video in Syria is back in the US and doing well.

title: Michael McIntyre: 'I'm used to viewers being cynical'
description: The comedian says many viewers don't believe the features on his Big Show are genuine.

title: The assassination of a ‘Brave Journalist of Afghanistan’
description: Aliyas Dayee, a "voice for the voiceless" in Helmand, was killed by a bomb earlier this month.

title: Conjoined twins: 'We always knew we were different'
description: They made headlines when surgeons separated them - now Sanchia and Eman Mowatt are at university.

title: The deep roots of Trump’s 'voter fraud' strategy
description: The groundwork for the president's unsubstantiated claims was laid months ago.

title: Life after al-Shabab: Driving a school bus instead of an armed pickup truck
description: The Somali government retrains defectors from the al-Shabab militant group as barbers, drivers, mechanics and tailors.

title: Why ATP Finals champion Medvedev won't celebrate his victories
description: Daniil Medvedev claims the biggest win of his career at the ATP Finals but does not celebrate and says he never will.

title: Trans teen in legal action over gender clinic wait
description: A 14-year-old transgender boy is taking legal action against NHS England over treatment delays.

title: Fur industry faces uncertain future due to Covid
description: Denmark's mass mink cull after a coronavirus outbreak at farms leaves the industry in the spotlight.

title: Covid risk: 3 people, 3 very different Covid risks. What's yours?
description: A question everyone's asking: what's my Covid risk? Here's how to find out.

title: Covid in North Dakota: One day inside a rural US hospital’s fight
description: Staff at a 14-bed hospital in North Dakota tell first-hand their fight to keep friends' family members alive.

title: The film crews being directed from a continent away
description: The pandemic has led to a big rise in remote filming, with directors miles away from the set.

title: Match of the Day 2: Liverpool 'game-changer' Diogo Jota's 'incredible' display in Reds win
description: Match of the Day 2 pundits Danny Murphy and Micah Richards outline the importance of new Liverpool signing Diogo Jota's role in the side after another "incredible" performance.

title: John Boyega stars in Steve McQueen's latest Small Axe film: Red, White and Blue
description: Life imitates art for John Boyega as he plays a police officer fighting racism, in the same year he took centre stage at the Black Lives Matters protest.

title: Shamima Begum: Justice and the jihadi bride
description: Why this case - which returns to court today - is bigger than the fate of one teenage runaway.

title: Lea Volpe: 'Why are you calling me inspirational?'
description: Paraclimbing medalist Leanora Volpe doesn't like to be defined solely as a disabled athlete.
